U0VL8o4de5UR3qwLlcoswg.text: We found this little restaurant on Yelp while visiting Edinburgh and we're very pleased with our choice to visit. The food was excellent the service was superb and friendly we loved the area it was in I had the full Scottish breakfast and everything on my plate was delectable my daughter had toast and beans and is now a fan. We look forward to going here again when we visit Scotland in the future

photos.caption: Photo of Laura's Kitchen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Happy patrons
Photo of Laura's Kitchen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Toast and beans
Photo of Laura's Kitchen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Full Scottish breakfast

zA1hH5MPq1CGzCt5PJfvVg.text: Cute little diner. Lots of options for salads, sounds and sandwiches. Definitely worth a stop if you are in the area for breakfast or lunch. Vegan and gluten free options too.

ftggEsR8TPPXifzccJWUIQ.text: Laura's Kitchen was like a breath of fresh air. Delicious scones, croissants and bakery items all homemade. I had the egg, croissant and bacon dish which was so tasty! My husband had been here in December and brought my daughter and I back to enjoy!! Prices are great and food is delicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of Laura's Kitchen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Laura's Kitchen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Laura's Kitchen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Croissants, scones and pastries

QzWNfcM3ALUlq1ORVRTpaQ.text: Great, fresh food.  Fantastic place for a home-made, fresh, healthy breakfast.  Great prices as well.  Amazingly diverse breakfast selection as well for being a small place.  Very fresh food, simple home cooking, made to order.

9e_5TpcCjPIyhfm-gh3MbA.text: This is indeed a hidden gem.  I was staying at a nearby budget hotel and didn't fancy their breakfast offering much, and am very glad I found Laura's Kitchen. Lovely coffee, a decent plateful of food and very friendly service.  I'd certainly come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Laura's Kitchen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

HVjYTvnTJbqMlm1E2JdVCw.text: Small shop with only a few seats but everything fresh and made in house. Almost walked into what I thought was the back room but was actually the kitchen. Your server is also the cook and all the baked goods seemed to be made in house. Coffee was amazing and the full breakfast had everything to sample for a Scottish breakfast. Black Pudding was very good as was everything else on the plate.  A nice find to be able plenty of items to sample for someone looking for something True to the city and not cookie cutter.

_J69TWvAWiR3Um_rDylnCA.text: Laura rocks! This is by far the best breakfast/lunch stop I've been to in all of Britain. Her eggs, scones & other baked goods, mixed salads, coffees - all amazing - eggs and creams are just better in this country than in the states from which we hail. I had cappucino, eggs and toast - simple stuff really but amazing by her hand. A special place, friendly and comfortable - highly recommend it.

I0_Z3J1ICWGqWzN7dmX63Q.text: There are so many restaurants to choose in Edinburgh that the process of choosing can be a little overwhelming sometimes; I'm glad that the last time I ate out, I chose Laura's Kitchen.  There's isn't a lot of seating here, but if you can't get seated they also do take-out.  You'll find a lot of good choices on the menu here.  Some of the dishes you'd expect to see in a place like this, others you wouldn't.    Tip: Be sure to check the Specials Board :-)  I often like to request a sandwich or a toastie made from ingredients displayed in the counter.  They also serve house-made cakes and soup.  Everything tastes and looks fresh; this is a great place to stop for tea and/or a snack :-)  The staff is patient, friendly, and attentive.  I particularly recommend this place if you're interested in an inexpensive, homey place to escape the hustle and bustle of High Street!

Hu54wmqYIihnQ00r0aTvDw.text: Laura's kitchen has been one of our favorite breakfast places in Edinburgh. They're eggs are simple, one of the only places that hasn't drenched their eggs in milk! The porridge has the perfect consistency and the toppings fresh. The waitress was even willing to add apple as a topping even though it wasn't listed as an option. Very few restaurants around here are able or willing to fulfill at the customers request, so it was a pleasant surprise! The service is prompt and the waitress pleasant. A friendly and clean atmosphere, though small, you can feel comfortable here. Decent Americano as well. I would absolutely recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Laura's Kitchen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Laura's Kitchen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Laura's Kitchen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

d4Z16FxIan8BHz59_hV94g.text: We loved this place! Quiet, quaint, FRIENDLY!!!!!  As traveling Americans we try to support local businesses at home and abroad. This is the epitome of a small business. Please go have a great breakfast or lunch.

hkhQRmjW4o_tqJD73xA0uA.text: After going to the wrong end of William St (thanks Yelp's silly map), we finally found Laura's and it was worth the wait. A sweet little place with a few small table rounds and a longer bar against the wall, it was more than enough for a sit down.  I ordered the full Scottish breakfast and husband ordered a ham croissant and hot chocolate. My full breakfast came out with all the trimmings overflowing the plate: fried egg, beans, pancake, hash brown, mushrooms, bacon, sausage, haggis, corned beef, black pudding, toast and coffee! Talk about FULL. :) Everything was great - even the black pudding, which I ate until I made the mistake of asking what was in it. :P Rookie tourist.  Husband's hot chocolate was beautiful and brimming with whipped cream and white and pink marshmallows.  Laura (I assumed that was her name?) was lovely and friendly. The prices were much more reasonable than any recommendations from our hotel and I'd definitely lead people here for a proper authentic meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Laura's Kitchen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sweet little place not to miss in Edinburgh West End!
Photo of Laura's Kitchen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Laura's Kitchen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Now THAT&#39;S a full Scottish breakfast.

op5z2Om7ITE-JRmPqv7fFg.text: Happy Second anniversary! Lovely and quaint cafe. The porridge, toast, and coffee were all excellent.

IW6106o5KMMAq6kuvPRfrg.text: A new wee gem in West End, with home made scones, home made marmalade, plenty of breakfast and lunch options, sandwiches, sit-in area!   Laura heated it up the scone for me today, such a nice treat!! The marmalade was delicious, nicely put in a paper bug for take away.   My cappuccino was spot on! Not too strong, with the milk heated just enough!!!   I'm going to try their porridge soon - only 1 and it's not an instant one, but proper with milk etc.  There is also a loyalty card: your 5th coffee for free!   Handy for lunches or breakfasts before work!   All the best!

cYDr57ijy3CMjFoUt5TTgg.text: Really really lovely cafe. Menus are handwritten and the ladies behind the counter were very down to earth and kind. Really tasty breakfasts too! Thanks for making our morning in Edinburgh a good one.

nJ8xweyoZAaxH_o4RQzSPA.text: I had a porridge with bananas and honey and my wife had scrambled eggs on toast. All was delicious! Very creamy porridge. The cappuccinos were great with enough espresso inside to keep us going until lunchtime. The homemade rolls looked nice, too. You can get them with plenty different fillings.

DUuy8951ft1fCALJq3916w.text: Best breakfast in two weeks!  We have been in London, Paris, and all across Scotland.  This truly was a treat.

photos.caption: Photo of Laura's Kitchen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Don&#39;t miss this treasure.
Photo of Laura's Kitchen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Full Scottish breakfast

bbPVlD9Xxr0LUsdbY5sRUA.text: Fantastic breakfast best ever. Beware Yelp map location is wrong. It's at the far end of William St

jBG_B3RFO9ffrz2XSXcPKQ.text: This time we stopped in for lunch. Delicious, generous portions, love, love, love this darling place!

r7Mfplb3W0gPu_De65rtRg.text: What a surprise given the previous reviews.  Vegetarian breakfast:  scambled eggs that tasted like air, hash browns in the shape of a triangle that looked like the kind you defrost from a freezer package, and beans that looked and tasted right out of a can. The mushrooms and tomatoe were home made.  Very small interior. Friendly service.
